column5: Well after the good day with Iceguy De-winterizing his boat yesterday,  I thought today would be my boats turn, so this morning, got up early and headed out.  Well...  PB lake trout for me yesterday,  And today, PB brown trout. (man I love lake O)  went 3 for 4 before it picked up with the east winds.  Here's a few pics before my camera batteries died.        Picture doen't do justice.  Thats a 3.5 ft salmon net. About 12-15 lbs    The release     The soft water season has begun!!!  (finally)  now the boats ready for Quinte opener.  Hope to see y'all out there!!
Thats a monster brown trout Matt , wish I could of came out today....posponed studying for a few hours to get my boat out of hibernation....good way to start the soft water season
Nice Browns. I least you brought a net with you.   How about some pliers?
WOW! Nice clean fish for sure, Matt. Congrats and thanks for sharing.
Back to back PB's...looks like your in for a great year...congrats and thanks for sharing
Very nice Brown indeed .I think you need a bigger net the way you catch fish
Nice stuff Matt... I pet my boat today, but know better than to pull the cover off just yet!
Congrats on your PB. Is it just me or did your camera change dates for the last two pics?
Ya Rob,  I learned from your mistake yesterday,  makes it alot easier  ya Twilight. I realized in between pics that I hadn't reset time/date yet.  I just got it back from repair.
That's a real fine brown there. A good spot for browns as well. You can flatline them in 10 - 20 ft. of water near the shore around there right now.  Nice fish and report,  ehg
That sure is a beauty of a brownie ya got there... make sure not to catch em all before the tourney starts, otherwise they're going to start getting smart  WTG Matt
Nice brown wtg on your PB  Rob

I nearly cried yesterday when I saw the video, today I did shed a tear seeing the pics. One of the nicest weather weekends this year and I had to work both days. Excellent job this weekend Matt. I'm so jealous. lol!  Way to go buddy.
